basicdata.Description: A common filamentous fungus used in industrial fermentation. It is known for producing citric acid and enzymes such as amylase and protease.

habitat: Aspergillus niger is commonly found in decaying plant material, soil, and food products.
importance: This fungus is widely used in biotechnology, food production, and pharmaceuticals, especially in the production of enzymes and organic acids.

Chemicals Produced.Citric Acid: Used in food, pharmaceuticals, and industrial applications.
Chemicals Produced.Gluconic Acid: Used in cleaning agents and pharmaceutical formulations.
Chemicals Produced.Amylase: Enzyme used for starch breakdown in food processing.
Chemicals Produced.Protease: Enzyme used in detergents and leather processing.
Chemicals Produced.Fumonisin B2: A secondary metabolite with potential toxicity concerns.

otherNames.name: Aspergillus awamori
otherNames.definition: A variant or subspecies name historically used for certain strains of Aspergillus niger.

otherNames.name: Sterigmatocystis niger
otherNames.definition: An older name once used to refer to Aspergillus niger before its reclassification.
